Temporary Leave of Absences

Family and Medical Leave (FLMA) Disclosure

Eligible employees may take Family and Medical Leave (FMLA) for absences greater than three days for a qualifying condition. If eligible, FMLA will be applied to all qualifying temporary leaves of absence.

Qualifying Conditions

  • Personal Illness - for a serious health condition that prevents the employee from performing the essential functions of the employee’s job
  • Maternity/Paternity/Adoption – for the birth or placement of a child for adoption or foster care
  • Family Member Illness – for a need to care for the employee’s spouse, child, or parent with a serious health condition
  • Military - Qualifying exigencies arising out of the fact that the employee’s spouse, son, daughter, or parent is on active duty or call to active duty status as a member of the National Guard or Reserves in support of a contingency operation

Additional information on FMLA →

Overview of Each Condition

Jump to: Maternity/Paternity/Adoption | Personal Illness | Family Member Illness | Military

Maternity/Paternity/Adoption

What should I use as my start date on my request for leave of absence paperwork?

The estimated due date for the baby is used as the start date. The end date would be the last day of your leave before you plan on returning to work.

Required Documentation

  • Request Form
  • Physician Certification Form
  • Benefits Billing Form
  • Maryland State Retirement Form - optional and only if absence will be unpaid AND greater than 30 days.

What should I do when the baby is born?

Contact Pamela Saulsbury via phone or email with the birth date. Fax a verification of birth and delivery type (regular or cesarean section) to Pamela Saulsbury 410-313-1565(fax). To add the baby to your health insurance, send the verification of birth and Benefits Change Form to the Benefits Office within 30 days after the birth.

If I am expecting a baby, how far in advance of my due date may I stop working?

You may stop working on your own accord within one week of your expected due date. In order to stop working prior to that, you need to submit medical documentation from your physician stating the need to stop working.

Frequently Asked Questions:

If I am a 10-month employee and my baby is born in the summer, am I eligible for FMLA in the fall?

You may take FMLA at the start of the school year, as FMLA allows an employee to be absent for 60 working days. You will be able to use earned/unearned sick leave for the period in which you are under doctor’s care for a medical recovery period (6-8 weeks). If you deliver during the summer, and your medical recovery period extends through the start of the school year, you are able to use earned/unearned sick leave for the number of duty days that you miss at the start of the school year. If your medical recovery period expires before the start of the school year, but you are still on an approved leave of absence, you will no longer be eligible to use your earned/unearned sick leave. If you do not miss any duty days in connection with your pregnancy, you will not be charged any leave.

Example: Your baby is born July 3, and your doctor says you may return to work after six weeks, which would be August 14. When school starts you would be able to take leave until the middle of November, but it would be unpaid because it is after the date your doctor has designated as the date you may return to work.

Are non-scheduled work days counted in the disability period for child birth?

Yes, non-scheduled work days are counted in the disability period for child birth.

For instance: If the disability period occurs during Spring Break, the non-scheduled days count towards the disability period. However, you will not be charged sick or personal leave on non-scheduled days.

What happens if the baby is not delivered on the expected date?

If the baby is delivered early, the employee will need to contact Human Resources and submit the verification of birth and delivery type. If the baby is not delivered on the expected date and you continue to work, contact Human Resources.

If I am expecting a baby, how far in advance of my due date may I stop working?

You may stop working on your own accord within one week of your expected due date. In order to stop working prior to that, you need to submit medical documentation from your physician stating the need to stop working.

How much leave may a husband and wife take if they are both employed by HCPSS?

Spouses employed by the same employer are limited in the amount of leave they may take for the birth and care of a child or placement of a child for adoption or foster care to a combined total of 12 work weeks (or 26 work weeks if leave to care for a covered service member with a serious injury or illness is also used). Leave for birth and care, or placement for adoption or foster care, must conclude within 12 months of birth or placement.

Example: If spouses are employed by HCPSS and the wife takes 10 weeks FMLA for the birth of a child, and the husband takes 2 weeks of FMLA to care for the child, then the husband will still have 10 weeks of FMLA available to take for his own personal illness and the wife will have 2 weeks available for her own personal illness, if needed.

What should I do when the baby is born?

Contact Pamela Saulsbury via phone or email with the birth date. Fax a verification of birth and delivery type (regular or cesarean section) to Pamela Saulsbury 410-313-1565(fax). To add the baby to your health insurance, send the verification of birth and Benefits Change Form to the Benefits Office within 30 days after the birth.

What If I get sick when I am pregnant or my doctor puts me on bedrest?

If you become ill for a pregnancy related condition, you may utilize your leave as you would for any normal circumstance (i.e. sick, personal, annual) and should contact the Office of Human Resources to inquire about next steps pertaining to your leave.

Personal Illness

Employees who have been/will be absent for more than 5 consecutive days need to apply for a leave of absence with the Office of Human Resources.

What date should I use as the start of my leave of absence?

Your leave of absence will begin as of the first date that you were/will be absent. Please be sure to communicate this date to your physician so that they may take this date into consideration when determining the period of incapacity for your leave of absence.

The leave of absence start date on your request for leave of absence form must match the start date on your physician certification form.

Required Documentation

  • Request Form
  • Physician Certification Form
  • Benefits Billing Form
  • Maryland State Retirement Form - optional and only if absence will be unpaid AND greater than 30 days.

Do I enter my time off in Workday?

Yes. Until you have applied and been approved for a leave of absence through the Office of Human Resources, you should enter your time off in Workday. Once your leave of absence has been approved, the Payroll office will take over entering time off on your behalf.

What type of leave may I use while on a leave of absence?

Per HCPSS Policy 7100-IP, the following paid leave may be used for eligible employees as part of the approved FMLA leave in accordance with the negotiated agreements:

  • Sick leave must be used
  • Annual leave may be used
  • Personal leave may be used

Note: It is the employee’s responsibility to select what type of leave (sick, annual, and personal) they wish to use when requesting a leave of absence. If no options are selected on the request for leave of absence form, the Office of Human Resources will apply only the required leave types that are applicable to the employee’s leave of absence.

Frequently Asked Questions:

What if I do not have enough applicable paid leave (sick, annual, personal) to cover my leave of absence?

Per HCPSS Policy 7100-IP, once any/all required leave types have been exhausted, The Office of Human Resources may approve the use of unpaid leave for employee leaves of absence.

What if I have exhausted my FMLA eligibility but am still sick?

Per HCPSS Policy 7100-IP, Employees are expected to return to work immediately following the expiration of FMLA leave. However, if an eligible employee is unable to return to work at the expiration of the FMLA leave, the employee may request approval for additional leave under another designated type of leave available to employees. Such requests must follow procedures and criteria established by the Office of Human Resources.

Do I need a doctor’s note to return to work?

Per HCPSS Policy 7100-IP, prior to returning to work, an employee on FMLA leave for his/her own serious health condition is required to submit a physician’s certification stating that the employee is able to perform the functions of the job.

If, when applying for leave, your healthcare provider does not provide a return date, you must provide the Office of Human Resources an updated release to return to work one week prior to the estimated end of your leave of absence.

Note: Without a full release to return to work from your physician, you may not return to work.

What if I need to return to work prior to the approved end date of my leave of absence?

If you need to return to work prior to the end date of your approved leave of absence, you must contact the Office of Human Resources prior to reporting to work as well as provide an updated physician certification form. Without doing so, there is risk for negative payroll impact.

Family Member Illness

Employees who have been/will be absent for more than 5 consecutive days need to apply for a leave of absence with the Office of Human Resources.

What date should I use as the start of my leave of absence?

Your leave of absence will begin as of the first date that you were/will be absent.

Required Documentation

  • Request Form
  • Physician Certification Form
  • Benefits Billing Form

Do I enter my time off in Workday?

Yes. Until you have applied and been approved for a leave of absence through the Office of Human Resources, you should enter your time off in Workday. Once your leave of absence has been approved, the Payroll office will take over entering time off on your behalf.

What type of leave may I use while on a leave of absence?

Per HCPSS Policy 7100-IP, the following paid leave may be used for eligible employees as part of the approved FMLA leave in accordance with the negotiated agreements:

  • Accrued sick leave must be used
  • Annual leave may be used
  • Personal leave may be used

Frequently Asked Questions:

What if I have exhausted my FMLA eligibility but the family member I am caring for is still sick?

Per HCPSS Policy 7100-IP, Employees are expected to return to work immediately following the expiration of FMLA leave. However, if an eligible employee is unable to return to work at the expiration of the FMLA leave, the employee may request approval for additional leave under another designated type of leave available to employees. Such requests must follow procedures and criteria established by the Office of Human Resources.

Do I need a note to return to work?

No. You may return to work on the day indicated on your approved leave of absence paperwork.

What if I need to return to work prior to the approved end date of my leave of absence?

If you need to return to work prior to the end date of your approved leave of absence, you must contact the Office of Human Resources prior to reporting to work. Without doing so, there is risk for negative payroll impact.

Military

Employees who have been/will be absent for more than 5 consecutive days need to apply for a leave of absence with the Office of Human Resources. Eligible HCPSS employees are afforded 15 days of paid military leave on an annual basis.

What qualifies for a military leave of absence?

Please visit the website for additional information pertaining to eligibility.

What date should I use as the start of my leave of absence?

Your leave of absence will begin as of the first date that you were/will be absent.

Required Documentation

  • Request Form
  • Benefits Billing Form
  • Maryland State Retirement Form - optional and only if absence will be unpaid AND greater than 30 days.

Do I enter my time off in Workday?

Yes. Until you have applied and been approved for a leave of absence through the Office of Human Resources, you should enter your time off in Workday. Once your leave of absence has been approved, the Payroll office will take over entering time off on your behalf.

What type of leave may I use while on a leave of absence?

Eligible HCPSS employees are afforded 15 days of paid military leave on an annual basis. Once the request for leave of absence and corresponding documentation to support the request has been reviewed, these hours will be applied to your leave of absence.

Additionally, the following paid leave may be used for eligible employees as part of the approved FMLA leave in accordance with the negotiated agreements:

  • Accrued sick leave may be used
  • Annual leave may be used
  • Personal leave may be used

Frequently Asked Questions:

What if I have exhausted my FMLA eligibility but my military leave requires that I still be out?

Per HCPSS Policy 7100-IP, Employees are expected to return to work immediately following the expiration of FMLA leave. However, if an eligible employee is unable to return to work at the expiration of the FMLA leave, the employee may request approval for additional leave under another designated type of leave available to employees. Such requests must follow procedures and criteria established by the Office of Human Resources.

Do I need a note to return to work?

No. You may return to work on the day indicated on your approved leave of absence paperwork.

What if I need to return to work prior to the approved end date of my leave of absence?

If you need to return to work prior to the end date of your approved leave of absence, you must contact the Office of Human Resources prior to reporting to work. Without doing so, there is risk for negative payroll impact.
